abstract: Malaysia's Federal Court upholds conviction of jailed opposition leader Anwar Ibrahim on charges of sodomy, ending long legal battle and sidelining Ibrahim in advance of election in which he had sought to challenge Prime Minister Najib Razak; human rights groups say case against Anwar was politically motivated.

headline.print_headline: Malaysian Dissident Loses Bid for Freedom
headline.main: Convicted of Sodomy, Malaysian Opposition Leader Loses Bid for Freedom

snippet: Anwar Ibrahim, the jailed opposition leader, had hoped for a decision that would let him run against the scandal-ridden prime minister in a coming election....
lead_paragraph: Anwar Ibrahim, the jailed opposition leader, had hoped for a decision that would let him run against the scandal-ridden prime minister in a coming election.
